turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Déjanire.
turn.1: What is known about the opera Déjanire?
turn.2: Déjanire  Déjanire is an opera (tragédie lyrique) in 4 acts composed by Camille Saint-Saëns to a libretto in French by Louis Gallet and Camille Saint-Saëns.
turn.4: The last of Saint-Saëns' operas, it premiered on 14 March 1911 at the Théâtre de Monte-Carlo.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: One of the opera's central characters, Hercule (Hercules), had been the subject of two earlier symphonic poems by Saint-Saëns – "Le Rouet d'Omphale" (1872) and "La Jeunesse d'Hercule" (1877).
turn.7: What was the story of the opera?
turn.8: The story is based on "The Trachiniae" by Sophocles (also the source for Handel's opera "Hercules").
turn.9: What form of music was used?
turn.10: "Déjanire" began its life in 1898 as a play with accompanying symphonic music, choruses and a ballet.
turn.12: Fernand Castelbon de Beauxhostes, one of the owners of a newly constructed arena in Béziers (used primarily for staging bullfights), wanted to make Béziers a centre for the performance of open-air opera as well.
